request.description:
Deletes last inserted composition. To use this request insert a composition via a request that saves the returned composition id to "last_compositon_id" environment variable.

This variable will be cleared after successful deletion.

query.description: Evaluates current time before sending request.

request.description: Creates a new ehr entry and sets the environment variable ehr_id to the value of the ehr

item.name: Get EHR Status version at time

                    <archetype_id>
                      <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.device.v1</value>
                    </archetype_id>
                    <term_definitions code="at0000">
                      <items id="description">An instrument, apparatus, implant, material or similar, used in the provision of healthcare. In this context, a medical device includes a broad range of devices which act through a variety of physical, mechanical, thermal or similar means but specifically excludes devices which act through medicinal means such as pharmacological, metabolic or immunological methods.  The scope is inclusive of disposable devices as well as durable or persisting devices that require tracking, maintenance activities or regular calibration, recognising that each type of device has specific data recording requirements.</items>
                      <items id="text">Medical Device</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0001">
                      <items id="comment">This data element will capture the term, phrase or category used in clinical practice. For example: <brand name><machine> (XYZ Audiometer); <size> <brand name> <intravenous catheter> (14G Jelco IV catheter); or <brand name/type> <implant>. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible, although this may be local and depending on local supplies available.
</items>
                      <items id="description">Identification of the medical device, preferably by a common name, a formal fully descriptive name or, if required, by class or category of device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Device name</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0002">
                      <items id="description">Narrative description of the medical device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Description</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0003">
                      <items id="comment">Not applicable if a category is already recorded in 'Device name'.
 Example: if the 'Device' is named as a 'urinary catheter'; the 'Type' may be recorded as 'indwelling' or 'condom'.Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. This may include use of GTIN or EAN numbers.</items>
                      <items id="description">The category or kind of device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Type</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0004">
                      <items id="description">Name of manufacturer.</items>
                      <items id="text">Manufacturer</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0005">
                      <items id="description">Date the device was manufactured.</items>
                      <items id="text">Date of manufacture</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0006">
                      <items id="description">The number assigned by the manufacturer which identifies a group of items manufactured at the same time, usually found on the label or packaging material.</items>
                      <items id="text">Batch/Lot number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0007">
                      <items id="comment">This date usually applies only to single use or disposable devices.</items>
                      <items id="description">Date after which the device/product is no longer fit for use, usually found on the device itself or printed on the accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Date of expiry</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0008">
                      <items id="description">Additional narrative about the device not captured in other fields.</items>
                      <items id="text">Comment</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0009">
                      <items id="description">Further details about specific properties about the medical device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Properties</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0018">
                      <items id="description">Additional structured informations about identified components of the device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Components</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0019">
                      <items id="comment">For example: Owner, Contact details, Location, Network address, Date due for replacement, Calibration details etc.</items>
                      <items id="description">Further details about management and maintenance of the device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Asset management</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0020">
                      <items id="description">Number assigned by the manufacturer which can be found on the device, and should be specific to each device., its label, or accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Serial number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0021">
                      <items id="comment">Often fixed to the device as a barcode.</items>
                      <items id="description">A numeric or alphanumeric string that is associated with this device within a given system.</items>
                      <items id="text">Unique device identifier (UDI)</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0022">
                      <items id="description">The exact number assigned by the manufacturer, as it appears in the manufacturer's catalogue, device labeling, or accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Catalogue number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0023">
                      <items id="description">The exact model number assigned by the manufacturer and found on the device label or accompanying packaging.</items>
                      <items id="text">Model number</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0024">
                      <items id="comment">Coding of the name of the identifier with a coding system is desirable, if available.</items>
                      <items id="description">Unspecified identifier, which can be further specified in a template or at run time.</items>
                      <items id="text">Other identifier</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0025">
                      <items id="comment">When the medical device is an actual software application, record the version of the software using this data element. When the medical device has multiple software applications embedded within it, record each software component in a separate CLUSTER archetype within the Components SLOT - either as a nested instance of another CLUSTER.device archetype or using a CLUSTER archetype designed specifically for recording software details (but not yet available at time of this archetype development).</items>
                      <items id="description">Identification of the version of software being used in the medical device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Software version</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0026">
                      <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
                      <items id="text">Extension</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                    <term_definitions code="at0027">
                      <items id="comment">For example: a technical diagram of a device, or a digital image.</items>
                      <items id="description">Digital representation of the device.</items>
                      <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
                    </term_definitions>
                  </children>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.pulse.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">Measurement of the pulse rate, or heart rate, and description of associated characteristics.</items>
              <items id="text">Pulse</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">structure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">history</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
              <items id="text">Any event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="comment">Run-time name constraints have been specified, in order to simplify the renaming of this data element to Pulse Rate or Heart Rate, as required.</items>
              <items id="description">The rate, measured in beats per minute.</items>
              <items id="text">Rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">The observed regularity of the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Regularity</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">The rhythm is regular.</items>
              <items id="text">Regular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">The rhythm is regularly irregular.</items>
              <items id="text">Regularly Irregular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">The rhythm is irregular in a chaotic manner.</items>
              <items id="text">Irregularly Irregular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">List</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">List</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="description">The body position of the subject during the observation.</items>
              <items id="text">Position</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1000">
              <items id="description">The subject was lying flat.</items>
              <items id="text">Lying</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1001">
              <items id="description">The subject was sitting (for example on bed or chair).</items>
              <items id="text">Sitting</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1002">
              <items id="description">The subject was reclining.</items>
              <items id="text">Reclining</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1003">
              <items id="description">The subject was standing.</items>
              <items id="text">Standing</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1005">
              <items id="comment">It can be implied that the pulse is present if Rate >0 beats/min.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of a pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Pulse Presence</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1013">
              <items id="description">Details about the device used to observe the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Device</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1017">
              <items id="description">Details about physical exertion being undertaken during the examination.</items>
              <items id="text">Exertion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1018">
              <items id="comment">For example, presence of a pacemaker, level of anxiety; pain or fever etc.</items>
              <items id="description">Narrative description about any incidental factors that may be affect interpretation of the physical findings.</items>
              <items id="text">Confounding Factors</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1019">
              <items id="comment">For example, auscultation or electronic monitoring. </items>
              <items id="description">Method used to the pulse observe the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Method</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1022">
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the findings.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical Description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1023">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: Bradycardia, Extrasystoles or Sinus rhythm. Multiple statements are allowed. </items>
              <items id="description">Single word, phrase or brief description represents the clinical meaning and significance of the pulse or heart beat findings.</items>
              <items id="text">Clinical Interpretation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1024">
              <items id="description">A pulse or heart beat can be detected.</items>
              <items id="text">Present</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1025">
              <items id="description">A pulse or heart beat cannot be detected.</items>
              <items id="text">Absent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1026">
              <items id="description">The pulse rate, measured in beats per minute.</items>
              <items id="text">Pulse Rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1027">
              <items id="description">The heart rate, measured in beats per minute.</items>
              <items id="text">Heart Rate</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1028">
              <items id="description">The rhythm is irregular.</items>
              <items id="text">Irregular</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1030">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is desired, where possible. For example: full, thready, bounding, slow rising, or collapsing. Multiple terms may be recorded.</items>
              <items id="description">Description of the character of the pulse or heart beat.</items>
              <items id="text">Character</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1032">
              <items id="description">The findings are observed by physical touch of the observer on the subject.</items>
              <items id="text">Palpation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1033">
              <items id="description">The findings are observed with the assistance of a device, such as a stethoscope.</items>
              <items id="text">Auscultation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1034">
              <items id="description">The pulse findings are observed using a device, such as a pulse oximeter or cardiac monitor.</items>
              <items id="text">Device</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1036">
              <items id="description">Maximum rate of the pulse or heart beat observed during a period of exertion.</items>
              <items id="text">Maximum</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1037">
              <items id="description">Body site where the pulse or heart beat findings were observed.</items>
              <items id="text">Findings Location</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1038">
              <items id="description">The left radial artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Radial Artery - Left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1039">
              <items id="description">The right radial artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Radial Artery - Right</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1040">
              <items id="description">The region of the heart.</items>
              <items id="text">Heart</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1041">
              <items id="description">The left carotid artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Carotid Artery - Left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1042">
              <items id="description">The right carotid artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Carotid Artery - Right</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1043">
              <items id="description">The left femoral artery.</items>
              <items id="text">Femoral Artery - Left</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at1044">

              <items id="text">Femoral Artery - Right</items>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-EVALUATION.cpr_decision_uk.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">The outcome of a clinical decision as to whether cardio-pulmonary resuscitation should be undertaken or not. This is generally referred to in UK clinical guidance as the CPR (Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation) decision.</items>
              <items id="text">CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">The date at which the CPR decision was originally taken or last reviewed.</items>
              <items id="text">Date of CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">The clinical decision on whether cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) should be attempted. In some cases a clear answer may not be available to the recording clinician.</items>
              <items id="text">CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">Cardio-pulmonary resuscitation should be attempted.</items>
              <items id="text">For attempted cardio-pulmonary resuscitation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Cardiopulmonary resuscitation should not be attempted.</items>
              <items id="text">Not for attempted cardiopulmonary resuscitation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">Is the patient aware of the CPR decision?</items>
              <items id="text">Patient awareness of decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">The patient is not aware of the cardiopulmonary resuscitation decision.</items>
              <items id="text">Patient not aware of CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">The patient is aware of the cardiopulmonary resucitation decision.</items>
              <items id="text">Patient aware of CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">The date at which the CPR decision should be reviewed.</items>
              <items id="text">Date for review of CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="description">The location of the original CPR document, either a text description or an electronic link.</items>
              <items id="text">Location of CPR documentation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">Is the informal carer, or carers, aware of the CPR decision?</items>
              <items id="text">Informal carer awareness of decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="description">Has resuscitation been discussed with  the patient?</items>
              <items id="text">Discussion with patient</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="description">Has resuscitation been discussed with  the patient's informal carer or carers?</items>
              <items id="text">Discussion with informal carer</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0015">
              <items id="description">Resuscitation has been discussed with the patient's informal carer.</items>
              <items id="text">Resuscitation discussed with informal carer</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="description">Resuscitation has been discussed with the patient.</items>
              <items id="text">Resuscitation discussed with patient</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0017">
              <items id="description">Has the physical CPR form been completed?</items>
              <items id="text">CPR form completed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="description">The physical CPR form has been completed.</items>
              <items id="text">CPR form completed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0019">
              <items id="description">The physical CPR form has not been completed.</items>
              <items id="text">CPR form not completed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0021">
              <items id="description">Other narrative comment pertinent to the CPR decision.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0022">
              <items id="description">There is no clear information on the outcome of the CPR decision.</items>
              <items id="text">CPR decision status unknown</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0023">
              <items id="description">Resuscitation has not been discussed with the patient.</items>
              <items id="text">Resucitation not discussed with patient</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0024">
              <items id="description">Resuscitation has not been discussed with the patient's informal carer or carers.</items>
              <items id="text">Resuscitation not discussed with informal carer</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">The informal carer is not aware of the do not attempt cardiopulmonary resuscitation clinical decision.</items>
              <items id="text">Informal carer not aware of CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0026">
              <items id="description">The informal carer is aware of the do not attempt cardiopulmonary resucitation decision.</items>
              <items id="text">Informal carer aware of CPR decision</items>
            </term_definitions>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-INSTRUCTION.request-procedure.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0.145">
              <items id="description">Details about specific objective or goal to be achieved by procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Objective</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0.146">
              <items id="description">Description about the type of procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Type of procedure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">Generic request for a range of different healthcare services e.g referral, lab request, equipment request.</items>
              <items id="text">Healthcare service request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0000.1">
              <items id="description">Request for a procedure to be performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">Current Activity.</items>
              <items id="text">Request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service. This is also referred to as Placer Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor Identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="description">The date and time that the service should be performed or completed.</items>
              <items id="text">Date &/or time service required</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0062">
              <items id="description">A short description of the reason for the request or indication.  This is often coded with an external terminology.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason for request</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0064">
              <items id="description">A narrative description explaining the reason for request.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0065">
              <items id="description">Intended impact on underlying health condition or issue eg preventive, curative, palliative, adjunct, adjuvant or supportive.</items>
              <items id="text">Intent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0068">
              <items id="description">Urgency of the request.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0076">
              <items id="description">True indicates that additional information has been identified and will be forwarded when available eg incomplete pathology test results.</items>
              <items id="text">Supplementary information to follow</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0078">
              <items id="description">Details of the nature of supplementary information that is to follow e.g name of laboratory results.</items>
              <items id="text">Supplementary information expected</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0112">
              <items id="description">Local detailed information such as billing requirements.</items>
              <items id="text">Localisation</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0116">
              <items id="description">Language, transport or other personal requirements to support the patient's attendance or participation in provision of the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Patient requirements</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0121">
              <items id="description">Identification of the service requested. This is often coded with an external terminology.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure requested</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0127">
              <items id="description">The status of the request for service as indicated by the requester. 
Status is used to denote whether this is the initial request, or a follow-up request to change or provide supplementary information.</items>
              <items id="text">Request status</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0128">
              <items id="description">A list of person's or organisation who should receive copies of any communication.</items>
              <items id="text">Distribution list for response</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0132">
              <items id="description">Structured detail defining the service requested eg CLUSTER archetype specifying the specific details of the procedure, +/- anaesthetic requirements.</items>
              <items id="text">Specific details</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0135">
              <items id="description">A detailed narrative description of the service requested.</items>
              <items id="text">Description of Procedure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0136">
              <items id="description">The request is an emergency.</items>
              <items id="text">Emergency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0137">
              <items id="description">The request is urgent.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0138">
              <items id="description">The request is routine.</items>
              <items id="text">Routine</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0141">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor</items>
            </term_definitions>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-ACTION.procedure.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">A clinical activity carried out for screening, investigative, diagnostic, curative, therapeutic, evaluative or palliative purposes.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="comment">Coding of the specific procedure with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the procedure by name.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure name</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="comment">Use to capture detailed, structured information about anatomical location, method & technique, equipment used, devices implanted, results, findings etc.</items>
              <items id="description">Structured information about the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure detail</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields.</items>
              <items id="text">Comment</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated complications. If the requirements for recording complication are more complex then use of a specific CLUSTER archetype within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype is advised and this data element becomes redundant. </items>
              <items id="description">Details about any complication arising from the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Complication</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="comment">For example: the reason for the cancellation or suspension of the procedure.</items>
              <items id="description">Reason that the activity or care pathway step for the identified procedure was carried out.</items>
              <items id="text">Reason</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="description">The procedure to be undertaken is planned.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure planned</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0035">
              <items id="description">Request for procedure sent.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure request sent</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0036">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been scheduled.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure scheduled</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0038">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been postponed.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure postponed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0039">
              <items id="description">The planned procedure has been cancelled prior to commencement.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure cancelled</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been suspended.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure suspended</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0041">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been aborted.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure aborted</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0043">
              <items id="description">The procedure has been performed and all associated clinical activities completed.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure completed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0047">
              <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure performed</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0048">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Outcome of procedure performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Outcome</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0049">
              <items id="comment">For example: description about the performance and findings from the the procedure, the aborted attempt or the cancellation of the procedure.</items>
              <items id="description">Narrative description about the procedure, as appropriate for the pathway step.</items>
              <items id="text">Description</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0053">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0054">
              <items id="description">The local ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor order identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0055">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation requesting the service.</items>
              <items id="text">Requestor</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0056">
              <items id="description">The ID assigned to the order by the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service. This is also referred to as Filler Order Identifier.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver order identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0057">
              <items id="description">Details about the healthcare provider or organisation receiving the request for service.</items>
              <items id="text">Receiver</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0058">
              <items id="comment">Coding with a terminology is preferred, where possible.</items>
              <items id="description">Urgency of the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Urgency</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0060">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure performed' pathway step, and in situations where the procedure is repeated on multiple occasions before being completed or there are multiple components to the whole procedure. This may be the same as the RM time attribute for the 'Procedure completed' pathway step.</items>
              <items id="description">The date and/or time when the entire procedure, or the last component of a multicomponent procedure,  was finished.</items>
              <items id="text">Final end date/time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0061">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure completed' pathway steps.</items>
              <items id="description">The total amount of time taken to complete the procedure, which may include time spent during the active phase of the procedure plus time during which the procedure was suspended.</items>
              <items id="text">Total duration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0062">
              <items id="description">Mulitimedia representation of a performed procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0063">
              <items id="comment">Occurrences for this data element are unbounded to allow for clinical scenarios such as removing multiple skin lesions in different places, but where all of the other attributes are identical. Use this data element to record simple terms or precoordinated anatomical locations. If the requirements for recording the anatomical location are determined at run-time by the application or require more complex modelling such as relative locations then use the CLUSTER.anatomical_location or CLUSTER.relative_location within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the anatomical location is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of the body site for the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Body site</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0064">
              <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
              <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
              <items id="text">Extension</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0065">
              <items id="comment">Use this data element to record simple terms or a narrative description. If the requirements for recording the method require more complex modelling then this can be represented by additional archetypes within the 'Procedure detail' SLOT in this archetype. If the method is included in the 'Procedure name' via precoordinated codes, this data element becomes redundant.</items>
              <items id="description">Identification of specific method or technique for the procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Method</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0066">
              <items id="comment">Only for use in association with the 'Procedure scheduled' pathway step.</items>
              <items id="description">The date and/or time on which the procedure is intended to be performed.</items>
              <items id="text">Scheduled date/time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0067">
              <items id="comment">This pragmatic data element may be used to support organisation within the user interface.</items>
              <items id="description">The type of procedure.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure category</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0068">
              <items id="description">The procedure, or subprocedure in a multicomponent procedure, has been commenced.</items>
              <items id="text">Procedure commenced</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>

            <archetype_id>
              <value>openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.demo.v1</value>
            </archetype_id>
            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">Demonstration archetype with descriptions and explanations</items>
              <items id="text">Demonstration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Event Series</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">All archetypes of the OBSERVATION class contain a HISTORY or EVENT model which contains information about the timing of the observation and the 'width' of the information - either a point in time or an inteval.  The default is 'Any event' and it is not specified if this is a Point in time or an Interval</items>
              <items id="text">Any event</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">This is a symbol for a cluster which can have other elements 'nested' within it</items>
              <items id="text">Heading1</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Text data type in which free text can be entered or coding can be incorporated either in the template or at run time.</items>
              <items id="text">Free text or coded</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0006">
              <items id="description">Text data type which can use an internal vocabulary.  Each of these 'internal codes' can be bound to a terminology code.</items>
              <items id="text">Text that uses Internal codes</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">Patient is lying supine</items>
              <items id="text">Lying</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0008">
              <items id="description">Patient is reclining, propped up on one medium pillow</items>
              <items id="text">Reclining</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0009">
              <items id="description">Patient is sitting on a chair</items>
              <items id="text">Sitting</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0010">
              <items id="description">Patient is standing</items>
              <items id="text">Standing</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0011">
              <items id="description">Text data type utilising codes derived from an external terminology source eg a SNOMED-CT, LOINC or ICD subset</items>
              <items id="text">Text that is sourced from an external terminology</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0012">
              <items id="description">A quantity data type used to record a measurement associated with its' appropriate units.  These are derived from ISO standards and the Reference model enables conversion between these units. The example shown here is length.</items>
              <items id="text">Quantity</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0013">
              <items id="description">Count data types are composed of an integer with no units eg for recording the number of children - in this example the minimum is set at 0 and the maximum not specified.</items>
              <items id="text">Count</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0014">
              <items id="description">Date/Time datatype allows recording of a date and/or time, including partial dates such as year only or month and year only.  Allow all is the default - so all forms of date/time are permitted.</items>
              <items id="text">Date/Time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0015">
              <items id="description">Ordinal datatypes pair a number and text - in this way scores can be calculated in software, or progression can be assessed eg if used in a pain score</items>
              <items id="text">Ordinal</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0016">
              <items id="description">Boolean datatype that allows for true or false answers. </items>
              <items id="text">Boolean</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0017">
              <items id="description">The datatype for this 'any' element can be specified or constrained in a template or at run-time, but is not explicitly modelled in the archetype.</items>
              <items id="text">Any</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0018">
              <items id="description">This is a symbol for a cluster which can have other elements 'nested' within it</items>
              <items id="text">Heading 2</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0019">
              <items id="description">List of CLUSTER archetypes allowed to be included or excluded within this OBSERVATION archetype.</items>
              <items id="text">Slot to contain other Cluster archetypes</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0020">
              <items id="description">List of ELEMENT archetypes allowed to be included or excluded within this OBSERVATION archetype.</items>
              <items id="text">Slot to contain other Element archetypes</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0021">
              <items id="description">Duration datatype allows recording of the duration of clinical concepts.  'Allow all time units' is the default, although specific time units can be explicitly modelled.  Maximum and minum values can be set for each time unit.</items>
              <items id="text">Duration</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0022">
              <items id="description">Interval of integer datatype allows for recording of a range of counts eg 1-2 tablets prescribed.  Maximum and minimum values can be set for the lower count and the upper count.</items>
              <items id="text">Interval of Integer</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0023">
              <items id="description">Interval of quantity datatypes allow for the recording of a range of measurements in association with appropriate units eg 1-2cm (prescribed amount of cream for a rash).</items>
              <items id="text">Interval of Quantity</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0024">
              <items id="description">Interval of integer datatype allows for recording of a range of dates eg between September 1, 2008 and September 8, 2008.</items>
              <items id="text">Interval of Date</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">Choice datatype allows for a number of types of element to be specified simultaneously and which can constrained or selected within a template or at run-time.  In this example, a text datatype set to Free text or Coded and another that is constrained to Terminology record data about the same data element.</items>
              <items id="text">Choice</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0026">
              <items id="description">Multimedia datatypes allow for the recording of many types of multimedia files to be captured.  All available types have been explicitly selected in this example.</items>
              <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0027">
              <items id="description">URI datatypes allow for recording of relationships from this data to data recorded elsewhere.  These links can be within the same EHR, or external eg to a  URL.</items>
              <items id="text">URI - resource identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0028">
              <items id="description">Proportion datatypes allow for ratios, percent, fractions and proportions to be modelled.</items>
              <items id="text">Proportion</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0030">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0031">
              <items id="description">All archetypes of the OBSERVATION class can  contain a STATE model which contains information about the subject of data at the time the information was collected, and this information is required for safe clinical interpretation of the core information. An example is the position of the patient at the time of measuring a blood pressure.  Datatypes are identical to those explained in the Data model, above.</items>
              <items id="text">State - definition</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0032">
              <items id="description">All archetypes of the OBSERVATION class contain a DATA model  which contains the core information e.g. the systolic and diastolic pressures when measuring a blood pressure.</items>
              <items id="text">Data - definition</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0033">
              <items id="description">An event that is both named (eg Birth) and constrained as a Point in time event records the data elements in relation to a specified point in time eg Weight at Birth.</items>
              <items id="text">Named Point in time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="description">An event that is both named and constrained as an Interval event records the data elements in relation to a period of time eg Weight Loss over time.  The interval can be fixed or left unspecified.  In addition there are mathematical functions that can be specified to capture concepts such as change, decrease, increase, maximum, minimum, mean etc.</items>
              <items id="text">Named Interval</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0035">
              <items id="description">Offset Point in time records data at a point in time with a fixed offset of 5 minutes from another specified event eg recording a 2 minute Apgar reading at 2 minutes offset from Birth.</items>
              <items id="text">Offset Point in time</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0036">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0037">
              <items id="description">All archetypes of the OBSERVATION class can contain a PROTOCOL model which records information on how the information was gathered or measured, and any other information that is not required for safe clinical interpretation of the core Data. Datatypes are identical to those explained in the Data model, above.</items>
              <items id="text">Protocol - definition</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0038">
              <items id="description">No pain at all</items>
              <items id="text">No pain</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0039">
              <items id="description">Pain level rated as 1 out of a possible maximum score of 10</items>
              <items id="text">Slight pain</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0040">
              <items id="description">Pain level rated as 2 out of a possible maximum score of 1010</items>
              <items id="text">Mild pain</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0041">
              <items id="description">Pain level rated as 5 out of a possible maximum score of 10</items>
              <items id="text">Moderate pain</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0042">
              <items id="description">Pain level rated as 9 out of a possible maximum score of 10</items>
              <items id="text">Severe pain</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0043">
              <items id="description">Pain level rated as 10 out of a possible maximum score of 10</items>
              <items id="text">Most severe pain imaginable</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0044">
              <items id="description">Identifier datatypes enable recording of formal data identifiers</items>
              <items id="text">Identifier</items>
            </term_definitions>
          </children>
          <cardinality>
            <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
            <is_unique>false</is_unique>
            <interval>
              <lower_included>true</lower_included>
              <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
              <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
              <lower>0</lower>
            </interval>
          </cardinality>
        </attributes>
        <archetype_id>
          <value>openEHR-EHR-SECTION.adhoc.v1</value>
        </archetype_id>
        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.</items>
          <items id="text">Ad hoc heading</items>
        </term_definitions>
      </children>
      <cardinality>
        <is_ordered>false</is_ordered>
        <is_unique>false</is_unique>
        <interval>
          <lower_included>true</lower_included>
          <lower_unbounded>false</lower_unbounded>
          <upper_unbounded>true</upper_unbounded>
          <lower>0</lower>
        </interval>
      </cardinality>
    </attributes>
    <archetype_id>
      <value>openEHR-EHR-COMPOSITION.encounter.v1</value>
    </archetype_id>
    <template_id>
      <value>RIPPLE - Conformance Test template</value>
    </template_id>
    <term_definitions code="at0000">
      <items id="description">Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).</items>
      <items id="text">Encounter</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0001">
      <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
      <items id="text">Tree</items>
    </term_definitions>
    <term_definitions code="at0002">
      <items id="comment">e.g. Local hospital departmental infomation or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
      <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local context or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
      <items id="text">Extension</items>
    </term_definitions>
  </definition>
</template>

                <archetype_id>
                  <value>openEHR-EHR-CLUSTER.device.v1</value>
                </archetype_id>
                <term_definitions code="at0000">
                  <items id="description">Ein Instrument, ein Gerät, ein Implantat, ein Material oder ähnliches, das für die Bereitstellung von Gesundheitsleistungen verwendet wird. In diesem Zusammenhang umfasst ein medizinisches Gerät eine breite Palette von Geräten, die auf verschiedene physikalische, mechanische, thermische oder ähnliche Weise wirken, schließt jedoch insbesondere Geräte aus, die auf medizinischem Wege wirken, wie zum Beispiel pharmakologische, metabolische oder immunologische Methoden. Der Geltungsbereich umfasst
Einweggeräte sowie langlebige oder dauerhafte Geräte, die nachverfolgt,
gewartet oder regelmäßig kalibriert werden müssen, wobei zu berücksichtigen ist, dass für jeden Gerätetyp bestimmte Datenaufzeichnungsanforderungen gelten.</items>
                  <items id="text">Medizingerät</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0001">
                  <items id="comment">Dieses Datenelement erfasst den Begriff, die Phrase oder die Kategorie, die in der klinischen Praxis verwendet werden. Zum Beispiel: <Markenname> <Maschine> (XYZ-Audiometer); <Markenname> (14G Jelco IV-Katheter); oder <Markenname / Typ> <Implantat>. Die Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist nach Möglichkeit wünschenswert, auch wenn dies lokal sein kann und von den verfügbaren lokalen Lieferungen abhängt.</items>
                  <items id="description">Identifizierung des Medizingerätes, bevorzugt durch einen allgemein
gebräuchlichen Namen, einer formellen und vollständig beschreibenden Bezeichnung oder falls notwendig anhand einer Klasse oder Kategorie des Gerätes.</items>
                  <items id="text">Gerätename</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0002">
                  <items id="description">Beschreibung des Medizingerätes.</items>
                  <items id="text">Beschreibung</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0003">
                  <items id="comment">Nicht zutreffend, wenn eine Kategorie bereits unter "Gerätename" dokumentiert ist. 
Beispiel: Wenn das 'Gerät' als 'Harnkatheter' bezeichnet wird; der 'Typ' kann als 'Verweilkatheter' oder 'Kondom' aufgezeichnet werden. Die Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist wünschenswert, sofern dies möglich ist. Dies kann die Verwendung von GTIN- oder EAN-Nummern einschließen.</items>
                  <items id="description">Die Kategorie des Medizingeräts.</items>
                  <items id="text">Gerätetyp</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0004">
                  <items id="description">Name des Herstellers.</items>
                  <items id="text">Hersteller</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0005">
                  <items id="description">Herstellungsdatum des Gerätes.</items>
                  <items id="text">Herstellungsdatum</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0006">
                  <items id="description">Die vom Hersteller zugewiesene Nummer, die eine Gruppe von gleichzeitig hergestellten Artikeln kennzeichnet, die sich normalerweise auf dem Etikett oder dem Verpackungsmaterial befindet.</items>
                  <items id="text">Chargennummer</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0007">
                  <items id="comment">Dieses Datum gilt normalerweise nur für Einmalprodukte oder Einwegprodukte.</items>
                  <items id="description">Das Datum, ab dem das Gerät/Produkt nicht mehr einsatzfähig ist. Wird normalerweise auf dem Gerät selbst oder auf der beiliegenden Verpackung aufgedruckt.</items>
                  <items id="text">Ablaufdatum</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0008">
                  <items id="description">Informationen, die hier nicht strukturiert erfasst wurden.</items>
                  <items id="text">Kommentar</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0009">
                  <items id="description">Weitere Details zu bestimmten Eigenschaften des Medizingerätes.</items>
                  <items id="text">Eigenschaften</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0018">
                  <items id="description">Zusätzliche strukturierte Informationen zu identifizierten Komponenten des Geräts.</items>
                  <items id="text">Komponenten</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0019">
                  <items id="comment">Zum Beispiel: Eigentümer, Kontaktdaten, Standort, Netzwerkadresse, Ersetzungsdatum, Kalibrierungsdetails usw.</items>
                  <items id="description">Weitere Details zur Verwaltung und Wartung des Geräts.</items>
                  <items id="text">Geräteverwaltung</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0020">
                  <items id="description">Die vom Hersteller zugewiesene Nummer, die sich auf dem Gerät befindet, muss für jedes Gerät, sein Etikett oder die dazugehörige Verpackung spezifisch sein.</items>
                  <items id="text">Seriennummer</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0021">
                  <items id="comment">Oft als Barcode am Gerät befestigt.</items>
                  <items id="description">Eine numerische oder alphanumerische Zeichenfolge, die diesem Gerät in einem bestimmten System zugeordnet ist.</items>
                  <items id="text">Eindeutige Identifikationsnummer (ID)</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0022">
                  <items id="description">Die genaue vom Hersteller vergebene Nummer, wie sie im Herstellerkatalog, in der Gerätekennzeichnung oder in der Begleitverpackung angegeben ist.</items>
                  <items id="text">Katalognummer</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0023">
                  <items id="description">Die Modellnummer des Herstellers, die sich auf dem Geräteetikett oder der zugehörigen Verpackung befindet.</items>
                  <items id="text">Modellnummer</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0024">
                  <items id="comment">Sofern verfügbar, ist die Kodierung des Namens des Identifikators mit einem Kodierungssystem wünschenswert.</items>
                  <items id="description">Nicht spezifizierter Bezeichner, der in einer Vorlage oder zur Laufzeit weiter spezifiziert werden kann.</items>
                  <items id="text">Weitere ID</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0025">
                  <items id="comment">Wenn das Medizinprodukt eine eigentliche Softwareanwendung ist, erfassen Sie die Version der Software mit diesem Datenelement. Wenn in dem Medizingerät mehrere Softwareanwendungen eingebettet sind, zeichnen Sie jede Softwarekomponente in einem separaten CLUSTER-Archetyp im 
Komponenten-SLOT auf - entweder als verschachtelte Instanz eines
anderen CLUSTER.device-Archetyps oder unter Verwendung eines
CLUSTER-Archetyps, der speziell für die Aufzeichnung von
Softwaredetails entwickelt wurde (aber zum Zeitpunkt dieser
Archetypentwicklung noch nicht verfügbar war).</items>
                  <items id="description">Identifizierung der im Medizingerät verwendeten Softwareversion.</items>
                  <items id="text">Softwareversion</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0026">
                  <items id="description">Zusätzliche Informationen, die zur Erfassung des lokalen Kontexts oder
zur Angleichung an andere Referenzmodelle/Formalismen erforderlich sind.</items>
                  <items id="text">Erweiterung</items>
                </term_definitions>
                <term_definitions code="at0027">
                  <items id="comment">Zum Beispiel: ein technisches Diagramm eines Geräts oder ein digitales Bild.</items>
                  <items id="description">Digitale Repräsentation des Gerätes.</items>
                  <items id="text">Multimedia</items>
                </term_definitions>

          <items id="description">Standardmäßiger, nicht näher beschriebener Zeitpunkt oder Intervall Ereignis welches in einem Template oder bei der Anwendung genauer definiert werden kann.</items>

        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">Beschreibung der Geschichte oder der klinischen Vorgeschichte für das Fachgebiet der Pflege.</items>
          <items id="text">Geschichte</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0006">
          <items id="comment">Zum Beispiel: ein spezifisches Symptom wie Übelkeit oder Schmerzen; ein Ereignis wie ein Sturz vom Fahrrad; oder ein Anliegen wie der Wunsch, mit dem Tabakkonsum aufzuhören.</items>
          <items id="description">Strukturierte Angaben über die Geschichte der Person oder des Patienten.</items>
          <items id="text">Strukturierte Angabe</items>

            <term_definitions code="at0000">

              <items id="text">Beliebiges Ereignis</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">

              <items id="description">Das Symptom oder Anzeichen ist vorhanden.</items>

            <term_definitions code="at0000">
              <items id="description">Ein Personen- oder Selbstbeurteilungs-Screening-Fragebogen zur Ermittlung von Symptomen und Anzeichen.</items>
              <items id="text">Screening-Fragebogen zur Symptomen/Anzeichen</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0001">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">History</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0002">
              <items id="description">Standardwert, ein undefinierter/s Zeitpunkt oder Intervallereignis, das explizit im Template oder zur Laufzeit der Anwendung definiert werden kann.</items>
              <items id="text">Beliebiges Ereignis</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0003">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0004">
              <items id="description">Name des Symptoms oder Anzeichens, das geprüft wird.</items>
              <items id="text">Bezeichnung des Symptoms oder Anzeichens.</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0005">
              <items id="description">Das Symptom oder Anzeichen ist vorhanden.</items>
              <items id="text">Vorhanden?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0007">
              <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
              <items id="text">Item tree</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0021">
              <items id="comment">Zum Beispiel: Lokaler Informationsbedarf oder zusätzliche Metadaten zur Anpassung an FHIR-Ressourcen oder CIMI-Modelle.</items>
              <items id="description">Zusätzliche Informationen zur Erfassung lokaler Inhalte oder Anpassung an andere Referenzmodelle/Formalismen.</items>
              <items id="text">Erweiterung</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0022">
              <items id="description">Gruppierung von Datenelementen bezogen auf Screening auf ein einzelnes Symptom oder Anzeichen.</items>
              <items id="text">Spezifisches Symptom/Anzeichen</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0023">
              <items id="description">Das spezifische Symptom oder Anzeichen ist vorhanden.</items>
              <items id="text">Vorhanden</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0024">
              <items id="description">Das spezifische Symptom oder Anzeichen ist nicht vorhanden.</items>
              <items id="text">Nicht vorhanden</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0025">
              <items id="description">Zusätzliche Beschreibungen über die Symptome oder Anzeichen, die nicht in anderen Bereichen dargestellt wurden.</items>
              <items id="text">Allgemeiner Kommentar</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0026">
              <items id="description">Zusätzliche strukturierte Informationen zu einem bestimmten Symptom oder Anzeichen.</items>
              <items id="text">Detaillierte Angaben zum Symptom/Anzeichen</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0027">
              <items id="description">Es ist nicht bekannt, ob das Symptom oder Anzeichen vorhanden ist oder nicht.</items>
              <items id="text">Unbekannt</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0028">
              <items id="description">Vorhandensein relevanter Symptome oder Anzeichen.</items>
              <items id="text">Sind Symptome oder Anzeichen vorhanden?</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0029">
              <items id="comment">Erlaubt sind Angaben als Teildatum.</items>
              <items id="description">Datum/Uhrzeit, wann die ersten Symptome oder Anzeichen bemerkt wurden.</items>
              <items id="text">Auftreten von Symptomen oder Anzeichen</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0031">
              <items id="description">Symptome oder Anzeichen sind vorhanden.</items>
              <items id="text">Vorhanden</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0032">
              <items id="description">Keine Symptome oder Anzeichen sind vorhanden.</items>
              <items id="text">Nicht vorhanden</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0033">
              <items id="description">Es ist nicht bekannt, ob Symptome oder Anzeichen vorhanden sind oder nicht.</items>
              <items id="text">Unbekannt</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0034">
              <items id="comment">Zum Beispiel: Screening auf eine Infektionskrankheit, wie SARS-COV-2.</items>
              <items id="description">Der Grund für das gesamte Screening.</items>
              <items id="text">Zweck des Screenings</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0035">
              <items id="description">Zusätzliche Informationen über das spezifische Symptom oder Anzeichen, die nicht in anderen Bereichen dargestellt wurden.</items>
              <items id="text">Kommentar</items>
            </term_definitions>
            <term_definitions code="at0036">
              <items id="description">Beschreibung aller Symptome oder Anzeichen.</items>
              <items id="text">Beschreibung</items>
            </term_definitions>
